title: A comedian released this parody Eurodance song — and ignited an internet storm
description: The video is a winning combination of nostalgia, intrigue and surrealism. And its viral ascent can tell us a lot about modern meme culture.

title: In video, Rep. Ronny Jackson yells profanities at Texas trooper, is put on ground
description: "I'm gonna call the governor tomorrow," Rep. Ronny Jackson, R-Texas, said as he shouted obscenities at a trooper during an altercation at a rodeo.

title: Can movie theaters sustain the 'Barbie boost'?
description: Going to the movies is hot again thanks to the so-called "Barbie boost." Barbie, Oppenheimer and other movies continue to rev up the summer box office. But can theaters sustain the momentum?

title: The Georgia indictment charges a 19-member 'criminal enterprise.' Here's who they are
description: The indictment out of Fulton County alleges that former President Trump and 18 others conspired to overturn Georgia's 2020 election results. His codefendants include big names and local officials.

title: Pacific Northwest heat wave could break temperature records through Thursday
description: Temperatures will linger in the triple digits for parts of California, Oregon, Washington, Idaho and Montana this week, with little relief coming at night.

title: Up First briefing: Trump's Georgia indictment; DA Fani Willis; microbes and kimchi
description: Trump is indicted in Georgia for seeking to overturn the state's election results. DA Fani Willis, who is charging him, is no stranger to high-stakes cases. And, how microbes turn cabbage to kimchi.

title: Michael Oher of 'The Blind Side' says he wasn't adopted, but put in a conservatorship
description: Oher alleged Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy presented him with a document establishing a conservatorship shortly after he moved in with him, and said it was "for all intents and purposes, an adoption."

title: Why doctors pay millions in fees that could be spent on care
description: The shift to electronic medical payments gave rise to a new kind of health care middlemen, who now charge 1-5% every time insurers pay doctors. Here's how lobbyists convinced regulators this was OK.

title: Latinos are the biggest ethnic group in Texas, but their political power lags behind
description: Latinos in Texas have eclipsed non-Hispanic whites as the dominant ethnic group in the state, but the group's political power has yet to catch up.

title: What happens when thousands of hackers try to break AI chatbots
description: In a Jeopardy-style game at the annual Def Con hacking convention in Las Vegas, hackers tried to get chatbots from OpenAI, Google and Meta to create misinformation and share harmful content.

title: California grads headed to HBCUs in the South prepare for college under abortion bans
description: As young adults prepare to leave blue states and head to historically black colleges in states where abortion is banned, they're getting ready to safeguard their reproductive health during college.

title: Maui's wildfires are among the deadliest on record in the U.S. Here are some others
description: The wildfires that killed at least 99 people in Maui are the deadliest to hit the U.S. in more than a century. Here's a look back at some of the country's most lethal blazes and lessons learned.

title: The number of dead from Maui's fires rises as local residents press to see Lahaina
description: The death toll from the Maui wildfires rose again on Monday as officials warned that number would rise while also acknowledging public frustration from residents still barred from visiting Lahaina.

title: In charging Trump, the Atlanta-area DA relies on RICO law. Here's what it is
description: Georgia's Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations statute allows prosecutors to pursue criminal enterprises, and it was based on — and is broader than — federal RICO law.

title: Fani Willis, the Atlanta DA who's charging Trump, is no stranger to high-stakes cases
description: "My career has taught me, no matter the political pressure, just do what's right," Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis pledged as she took office.

title: No details yet, but Georgia grand jury returns indictment in 2020 election probe
description: A grand jury in Atlanta has presented its findings in an election interference probe to a Georgia judge, but no details were read aloud to gathered reporters.
